block.para: Here we illustrate the direction angles of a vector \Vect{x} in \RNr[2] and the two coordinate axes:

info.para: \Vect{e}_1 = (1,0) is the standard vector in the first coordinate direction.
\Vect{e}_2 = (0,1) is the standard vector in the second coordinate direction.
\omega_2 := \sphericalangle(\Vect{e}_2,\Vect{x}) is the second direction angle of the vector \Vect{x}.
\omega_1 := \sphericalangle(\Vect{e}_1,\Vect{x}) is the first direction angle of the vector \Vect{x}.

block.para: A vector \Vect{x} in \RNr[2] has two direction angles: the vector \omega_1 from the first coordinate axis, and the angle \omega_2 from the second coordinate axis.
